definition: the skin covering the part of the head where your hair is. If it itches (or is itchy), you want to scratch it.
example: I had an itchy scalp until I started using this special shampoo.

definition: a very bad headache.
example: I've got a splitting headache.

definition: an allergy affecting the nose, eyes, and throat, caused by pollen from plants.
example: I suffer from hay fever in the summer.

definition: small sore areas inside the mouth, usually lasting a few days.
example: Why does he get mouth ulcers?

definition: put a bone out of its normal position.
example: He dislocated his shoulder.

definition: an area of red spots on the skin, caused by an illness or a reaction to sth.
example: That's a nasty rash on your arm.

definition: unpleasant (also a nasty accident).
example: That's a nasty rash on your arm.

definition: a stomach problem causing sickness or diarrhoea.
example: I had an upset stomach this morning.

definition: passing waste from the body too often and in liquid form.
example: (Implied definition)

definition: unable to move waste material from the body. constipation N.
example: I often get constipated on holiday.

definition: the pressure of the blood as it moves round the body. (High and low blood pressure are problem conditions.)
example: My mother's got high blood pressure.

definition: injure a part of the body (usually the wrist or ankle) by turning it suddenly.
example: I sprained my ankle running.

definition: injure a muscle by stretching it too much.
example: He pulled a muscle in training.

definition: a sore swelling on the surface of the skin (here on the back of the foot) often caused by rubbing or burning.
example: I've got a blister on my heel.

definition: mix a solid with a liquid until it becomes part of it.
example: Tablets must be dissolved in water.

definition: (If sth is soluble it can be dissolved, e.g. soluble aspirin.)
example: (Definition only)

definition: the state of not having any energy to do things. lethargic ADJ.
example: This product can cause lethargy or drowsiness.

definition: the state of feeling tired and almost asleep. drowsy ADJ.
example: This product can cause lethargy or drowsiness.

definition: lasting only a short period, e.g. a short-term solution. OPP long-term.
example: For short-term use only.

definition: the amount of a medicine that you take at any one time.
example: Do not exceed the stated dose.

definition: included inside sth else, usually inside a letter or packet.
example: Please read the enclosed leaflet.

definition: one or several pages of information about sth.
example: Please read the enclosed leaflet.

definition: an extra and usually bad effect that a drug has on you.
example: Possible side effects may include stomach disorders.

definition: an illness in a part of the body.
example: Possible side effects may include stomach disorders.

definition: get rid of sth you no longer want or need.
example: Discard any remaining solution.

definition: continue to exist (used especially about sth unpleasant). persistent ADJ.
example: If symptoms persist, consult your doctor.

definition: the date after which sth should not be used. expire v.
example: Do not use after expiry date.

definition: 1. do more of sth than is stated in an order or a law. 2. be greater than a number, amount, or quality.
example: Do not exceed the stated dose. / The film exceeded my expectations.

definition: be greater than a number, amount, or quality.
example: The cost won't be in excess of $5,000.

definition: acting in an open and natural way, without worrying about what you say or do. spontaneity N.
example: I'm a spontaneous sort of person.

definition: the quality of being spontaneous.
example: I think spontaneity is a positive attribute.

definition: not caring or worrying about the future.
example: I'm a happy-go-lucky sort of person.

definition: sensible and realistic in things you say or think.
example: I'm pretty down-to-earth too.

definition: a person who talks a lot. chatty ADJ.
example: My friends say I'm a real chatterbox.

definition: very enthusiastic or interested in sth. passion (for sth) N.
example: I'm truly passionate about people.

word: give sth a go (SYN have a go)
definition: be prepared to try sth. SYN have a go, give sth a try.
example: I'll give anything a go.

definition: according to what is practical, possible, or sensible.
example: I'll give anything a go, within reason!

definition: be attracted to sb/sth.
example: I'm drawn to men who are considerate.

definition: always thinking about other people's wishes and feelings. OPP inconsiderate.
example: I'm drawn to men who are considerate.

definition: the feeling of liking or caring about sth/sb. affectionate ADJ.
example: happy to show affection.

definition: the quality of being honest and having strong moral principles.
example: A guy with integrity.

definition: trying to appear important, intelligent, etc. to impress others.
example: NOT pretentious.

definition: a quality or feature of sb/sth.
example: spontaneity is a positive attribute.

word: What do you make of sb/sth?
definition: = What's your impression of sb/sth?
example: What did you make of the two candidates for the job?
persian: نظر شما در مورد کسی/چیزی چیست؟

definition: An interesting or unusual person can be called a character (or a real character).
example: Joe Pascoe was a real character.

definition: able to think quickly; intelligent.
example: Joe Pascoe was quick-witted, and shrewd.

definition: good at judging people and situations.
example: Joe Pascoe was quick-witted, and shrewd.

definition: determined to get what you want and not caring about others.
example: I'd say pretty ruthless too.

definition: start liking sb/sth.
example: I didn't take to him personally.

definition: make a particular impression.
example: He came across as rather pushy.
persian: به نظر رسیدن/برداشت خاصی ایجاد کردن

definition: trying hard to get what you want, especially in a rude manner.
example: He came across as rather pushy.

definition: thinking you are very important, clever, etc.
example: a bit conceited.

definition: give sb a particular impression.
example: Catherine actually struck me as being more suitable.

definition: taking care to do things carefully and correctly.
example: She certainly seemed very conscientious.

definition: able to be relied on as good, honest, etc.
example: very conscientious and trustworthy.

definition: a quality that makes other people like you and be attracted to you. charismatic ADJ.
example: Does she have the necessary charisma?

definition: behaving confidently so that people take notice of what you say.
example: whether she's assertive enough for this role.

definition: annoy sb very much.
example: He's not the kind of person who'd get up people's noses.

definition: when not looked at or thought about carefully.
example: someone appears on the surface.

definition: not friendly towards others.
example: A person who seems aloof.

definition: not confident; not wanting to talk about yourself.
example: may just be shy and diffident.

word: don't judge a book by its cover (SAYING)
definition: don't form an opinion of sth/sb by their appearance only.
example: As they say: don't judge a book by its cover.

definition: a feature of sb's character.
example: Other personality traits can be misleading.

definition: giving the wrong idea or impression.
example: Other personality traits can be misleading.

definition: a good or desirable quality. OPP vice. virtuous ADJ.
example: being cunning, or impulsive... may be a virtue.

definition: able to do things by being clever, but not always honest.
example: being cunning, or impulsive.

definition: doing things quickly, without thinking about the results.
example: being cunning, or impulsive.

definition: lacking experience of life, and trusting others too easily. naivety N.
example: or naive.

definition: make sb suffer because it will be good for them later.
example: sometimes you have to be cruel to be kind.

definition: you believe people do things for themselves rather than for unselfish reasons. cynicism N.
example: My brother is very cynical about politicians.

definition: you are not confident that it is true or will happen. scepticism N.
example: I'm very sceptical about the results of this survey.

word: ecstatic (SYNS euphoric, elated, over the moon)
definition: very happy.
example: I was ecstatic about my new job.

definition: feeling extremely happy because of a success.
example: The jubilant fans were cheering.

definition: crying (close to tears = nearly crying).
example: She was in tears by the time we got to the hospital.

definition: very upset.
example: I was devastated when she left me.

word: lose your temper (SYN go mad INF)
definition: become very angry.
example: He completely lost his temper.

definition: become very angry.
example: He'll hit the roof when he sees it.

definition: very disappointed.
example: I was gutted when we lost the match.

definition: being in a state of extreme distress or excitement and crying, laughing, or shouting, etc.
example: Her mother became hysterical.

definition: shocked and surprised.
example: I was stunned when they gave me the prize.

definition: shocked because sth is very unpleasant.
example: I was appalled by the conditions they had to live in.

definition: extremely anxious.
example: Karen was desperate.

definition: an act of sheer (= absolute) desperation N.
example: Jumping into the freezing water was an act of sheer desperation.

definition: extremely unhappy.
example: He was desperately unhappy.

definition: stop yourself showing negative emotions or feelings, especially over a long time (bottle up your emotions).
example: Are you the kind of person who bottles up their emotions?

word: wear your heart on your sleeve
definition: make your feelings obvious to others.
example: Do you wear your heart on your sleeve?

definition: give sb information about sth, especially sth that has been secret.
example: if you disclose too much about yourself.

definition: weak and easily hurt, physically or emotionally.
example: make yourself rather vulnerable.

definition: slightly nervous, embarrassed, or worried.
example: I feel a bit uneasy when people pour out their thoughts.

definition: express all your feelings, often because you are unhappy.
example: people pour out their innermost thoughts to me.

definition: the thoughts which are most personal and private.
example: people pour out their innermost thoughts.

definition: a way of behaving that results from responses you were born with rather than responses you have learned. instinctive ADJ.
example: My own instinct is to be quite guarded.

definition: careful not to give too much information.
example: My own instinct is to be quite guarded.

definition: tell people secret information.
example: not give away too much about how I feel.

definition: stop yourself from having or expressing feelings.
example: unhealthy to suppress your feelings.

definition: (of emotions, energy, etc.) held back; not shown or expressed.
example: release your pent-up emotions.

word: my heart wasn't really in it
definition: I wasn't interested in or enthusiastic about it.
example: my heart wasn't really in it.

definition: I was unable to tell her she'd failed, because I knew she'd be upset.
example: I didn't have the heart to tell her she'd failed.

definition: Emotionally, I felt I should help him.
example: My heart told me to help him.

word: take an instant dislike to sb
definition: dislike sb as soon as you meet them.
example: they took an instant dislike to me.

definition: feel anger about sth, often when it seems unfair. resentment N.
example: They resented me being in their home.

definition: unfriendly and aggressive. hostility N.
example: they were openly hostile.

definition: If you say sth to sb's face, you say it to them directly.
example: nice enough to my face.

definition: saying nice things about sb.
example: not so complimentary behind my back.

definition: If you say or do sth behind sb's back, you say or do it without their knowledge, and usually it is bad or unkind.
example: behind my back.

definition: used for saying that sth is certain to happen. inevitable ADJ.
example: inevitably it put a strain on my relationship.

definition: create pressure and anxiety for sb; create tension in a relationship.
example: it put a strain on my relationship.

definition: support and defend sb if they are criticized.
example: he stuck up for me.

definition: over a period of time.
example: as time went by, things settled down.

definition: become calmer and more relaxed.
example: things settled down a bit.

definition: 1. difficult: It's a tough decision. 2. strict: tough new driving laws. 3. able to deal with difficult situations: She's tough.
example: It was a tough time.

definition: used to talk about a situation or life in general.
example: Now, two years on, things are looking up.

definition: start to become better.
example: things are looking up.

definition: in the beginning. initial ADJ.
example: Initially the kids were reluctant to accept me.

definition: not wanting to do sth. reluctance N.
example: the kids were reluctant to accept me.

definition: a connection between people based on shared feelings or experiences.
example: helped to create a closer bond.

definition: a feeling of admiration for sb because of their qualities. respect v.
example: I've gained their respect.

definition: tell sb personal information because you trust them.
example: they're prepared to confide in me now.

definition: a mixture of good and bad things in life or a relationship.
example: Vince and I still have our ups and downs.

definition: recognize sth and welcome it. appreciation N.
example: he appreciates the sacrifices I've made.

definition: give up sth important or valuable in order to do sth that seems more important. sacrifice sth v.
example: he appreciates the sacrifices I've made.

definition: 1. allow sb to be part of a group; 2. agree to sth; 3. believe that sth is true; 4. admit you did sth wrong.
example: They accepted me as one of the family.

definition: a woman you admire for her ability or personal qualities (hero for a man).
example: My heroine was Mother Theresa.

definition: the ability to do sth, even though it is dangerous, frightening, or very difficult. courageous ADJ.
example: I admired her courage.

definition: a calm, controlled manner in a difficult situation. dignified ADJ.
example: I admired her dignity.

definition: the quality of not believing you are better or more important than others. humble ADJ.
example: I admired her humility.

definition: give sb the enthusiasm and desire to do sth. inspiration N. inspirational ADJ.
example: she inspired me to devote my life.

definition: admire or love sb very much.
example: I used to idolize David Beckham.

definition: the hard work and effort that sb puts into an activity because they care about it. dedicate sth/yourself to sth/sb v. dedicated ADJ.
example: I admired him for his dedication.

word: have a go at sb (INF) (SYN criticize sb)
definition: say unkind things or complain about sb.
example: when the press had a go at him.

definition: admire and respect sb, often sb who is older or in a higher position.
example: I really looked up to my grandfather.

definition: do the same work or be as successful as sb before you.
example: I hope to follow in his footsteps.
persian: راه کسی را ادامه دادن/دنبال کردن

definition: a person who opposes people in authority. rebel v. rebellious ADJ.
example: Pop stars who start off as rebels.

definition: a person who believes the world can be perfect. idealistic ADJ.
example: Pop stars who start off as idealists.

definition: a person who says they have strong principles but does not act according to these principles. hypocrisy N. hypocritical ADJ.
example: What hypocrites!

definition: a person who thinks they are better than people in lower social classes.
example: Snobs.

definition: think that you are better than sb.
example: people who look down on others.
persian: با تحقیر نگاه کردن/خود را برتر دانستن

definition: not polite, elegant, or having good taste.
example: think they're vulgar.

definition: be hurt or frightened by sb who is bigger and stronger (the person who does the bullying is a bully).
example: I was bullied at school.

definition: hate and have no respect for sb/sth. despicable ADJ.
example: I've always despised bullies.

definition: deserving hatred and contempt.
example: just despicable in my opinion.

definition: showing hatred and the desire to hurt people's feelings. malice N.
example: malicious gossip.

definition: stories about other people's private lives, which may be unkind or untrue. gossip v (also spread gossip).
example: People who spread malicious gossip.

definition: strong beliefs that influence how you behave.
example: with strong moral principles.

definition: beliefs about what is right and important in life.
example: their values change completely.

definition: the basic character of a person.
example: Is it nature or nurture?

definition: the care and attention given to help sb develop. nurture sb v.
example: Is it nature or nurture?

definition: an effect or influence on sth.
example: various factors have an impact on our lives.

definition: be involved and influential in developing sth.
example: Parents play a crucial part.

definition: a person you admire and learn from.
example: other role models are less influential.

definition: the influence on your behaviour of people around you of the same age.
example: Peer pressure is a significant factor.

definition: a thing that encourages you to work harder, do sth, etc.
example: Positive incentives are effective.

definition: a thing that makes you less likely to do sth. deter sb v.
example: deterrents aren't effective.

definition: a family in which the parents are divorced or separated.
example: A broken home needn't have a detrimental effect.

definition: without sufficient food, education, or money. deprivation N.
example: deprived childhood.

definition: a very negative effect.
example: A broken home needn't have a detrimental effect.

definition: dirty or untidy. mess N.
example: Getting messy teens.

word: pull your weight (SYN do your fair share)
definition: work as hard as everyone else in a job or activity.
example: Getting messy teens to pull their weight.

word: go on and on (about sth, at sb)
definition: keep talking (about sth or to sb) in a boring way.
example: You can go on and on about the state of your bedroom.

definition: keep complaining about sb's behaviour.
example: (Implied context)

definition: not pleasant or attractive.
example: Their room may be untidy and unappealing.

definition: likely to cause death (here it is being used humorously).
example: it's not life-threatening.

word: fuss (N) (SYN kick up a fuss INF)
definition: If you make a fuss about sth, you become angry and complain about sth which probably isn't important.
example: why make a fuss?

definition: say officially what the rules are.
example: lay down rules for the rest of the home.

definition: behave in a way that others may copy.
example: Set an example by being tidy yourself.

definition: agree to do sth that you don't want to do.
example: don't give in and clear up their mess.

definition: To expect sth can mean to think it is right that sth should happen.
example: Most parents expect high standards.

definition: idiom used for saying you are not surprised by something, even though it is unpleasant or disappointing.
example: Teenagers are often lazy... but what do you expect?

definition: the formal rules of correct or polite behaviour in society.
example: Dining etiquette.

definition: behaviour that is considered polite in a particular society or culture.
example: good manners to eat all the food on your plate.

definition: (often passive) disapprove of sth/sb.
example: wasting food is frowned upon.

definition: having bad manners and not showing respect. courtesy N.
example: talking with your mouth full is viewed as being discourteous.

definition: usually done in a particular place or situation. custom N.
example: it's customary and respectful to pass food to the elderly first.

definition: showing polite behaviour towards sb/sth.
example: it's customary and respectful to pass food to the elderly first.

definition: moving or pointing towards a higher position.
example: leave them pointing upwards.

definition: rude in a way that makes sb upset or annoyed.
example: It can also be offensive to remove rice with a spoon.

definition: think about something in a particular way (used passively).
example: It is considered (to be) the correct thing to do.

definition: think about something in a particular way (used passively).
example: this is regarded as extremely disrespectful.

definition: think about something in a particular way (used passively).
example: talking with your mouth full is viewed as being discourteous.

definition: think about something in a particular way (used passively).
example: It is perceived as the correct thing to do.

definition: perfect (impeccable manners/behaviour/service).
example: Felicity's manners are impeccable.

definition: excellent, and done in a way that others should copy.
example: exemplary manners.

definition: rude, often in an amusing way (often used by adults about children). cheek N.
example: that brother of hers is a bit cheeky.

definition: extremely rude and disrespectful. insolence N.
example: I'd call him insolent, actually.

definition: used to emphasize sth negative (downright rude/offensive).
example: or even downright rude.

definition: be upset or offended.
example: I don't think Julian will be put out.

definition: say sth that offends or upsets sb.
example: I just don't want to put my foot in it.

definition: considered to have the highest social status.
example: His family are very upper class.

definition: behave in the most polite way you can.
example: you'll just have to be on your best behaviour.

definition: object strongly to sth and be angry about it.
example: I really took exception to Arnold's remarks.

definition: a few words that give your opinion about sth.
example: Arnold's remarks.

definition: very bad or unacceptable. disgrace N.
example: I thought they were disgraceful.

definition: be offensive and not at all appropriate.
example: They really were in poor taste.
